sub_topic: Calculation of standard enthalpy change for a vaporization reaction
message_1: What is the standard enthalpy change for the vaporization reaction of ethanol (C2H5OH) given that the heat of vaporization at its boiling point of 78.4 °C is 38.56 kJ/mol?
message_2: The standard enthalpy change for the vaporization reaction of ethanol (C2H5OH) is the heat of vaporization at its boiling point. In this case, the heat of vaporization is given as 38.56 kJ/mol at 78.4 °C. Therefore, the standard enthalpy change for the vaporization reaction of ethanol is 38.56 kJ/mol.
